meanings.definition: Five times as much or as many.
meanings.sent1: The quintuple amount of candies made the children very happy.
meanings.sent2: She bought a quintuple number of balloons for the party.
meanings.sent3: The quintuple servings of ice cream were a delightful surprise.
meanings.sent4: The quintuple stars in the sky shone brightly that night.
meanings.sent5: The quintuple rainbow after the rain was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: To increase or be increased five times.
meanings.sent1: They decided to quintuple their efforts to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to quintuple its production by next year.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to quintuple in size overnight!
meanings.sent4: His excitement quintupled when he heard the good news.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd quintupled as the team scored the winning goal.
